newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds up little, low activity seen lasting.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds up little, low activity seen lasting.

text.p: Danish bond prices failed to budge much in a becalmed market on Thursday with dealers seeing little sign of any major changes ahead due to the lack of market moving data.

"The morning's Danish October and unemployment data were as expected. The government's accord with the leftist Socialist Peoples' Party on parts of the 1997 state budget had no effect on prices," one dealer said.
The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 was up a marginal 0.09 point from the start at 108.62, yielding 6.71 percent in turnover of one billion crowns.
The benchmark 2006's December future fell 0.03 point to 108.53 with 312 contracts traded. The six percent mortgage bond due 2026 lost 0.30 point to 85.36.
The crown traded at 3.8374 per mark at 1200 gmt, up from around 3.8382 at the opening.
The 10-year yield gap with Germany was unchanged at 94 from the start.
